title: How to Make Joojeh Kebabs

steps.headline: Rinse the chicken well with cold water, then pat dry.
Place the pieces in a bowl and add grated onion, lemon juice, saffron, salt, chili powder and black pepper and mix well.
steps.description: The chicken should now be tinted slightly orange.

steps.headline: Add olive oil and whisk until ingredients are well combined.
Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap or a muslin cloth and marinate in the refrigerator for 24-48 hours.
Remove the chicken from refrigerator and bring it to room temperature (about 45-50 minutes).
Thread the chicken pieces onto long, thin metal skewers, separating each by 1" (2cm).
Grill the chicken pieces over a moderately hot gas flame, charcoal grill, or electric grill for about 10-15 minutes.
Turn the skewers periodically and baste the pieces with the remaining marinade.
steps.description: When done, the pieces should be golden brown on all sides and no longer pink inside.

steps.headline: Check one piece of the Joojeh kebab by cutting through it with a knife.
steps.description: If it is white and juicy, then it is ready.

steps.headline: Serve on Basmati rice or wrapped in Lavash bread.
steps.description: In Iran these kebabs are often served like this.

steps.headline: Serve it over a bed of grilled tomatoes, grilled or raw peppers, fresh lemons, or other vegetables.
Present it with white rice, a dab of softened butter, and a sprinkling of sumac.

text: Preparation and Marination of Chicken Rinse the chicken well with cold water, then pat dry.  Cut the chicken into 1" cubes.  Place the pieces in a bowl and add grated onion, lemon juice, saffron, salt, chili powder and black pepper and mix well. The chicken should now be tinted slightly orange. Add olive oil and whisk until ingredients are well combined.  Cover the bowl with a plastic wrap or a muslin cloth and marinate in the refrigerator for 24-48 hours.  Cooking Remove the chicken from refrigerator and bring it to room temperature (about 45-50 minutes).  Thread the chicken pieces onto long, thin metal skewers, separating each by 1" (2cm).  Grill the chicken pieces over a moderately hot gas flame, charcoal grill, or electric grill for about 10-15 minutes.  Turn the skewers periodically and baste the pieces with the remaining marinade. When done, the pieces should be golden brown on all sides and no longer pink inside. Check one piece of the Joojeh kebab by cutting through it with a knife. If it is white and juicy, then it is ready. Remove the kebabs from fire.  Serving Suggestions Serve on Basmati rice or wrapped in Lavash bread. In Iran these kebabs are often served like this. Serve it over a bed of grilled tomatoes, grilled or raw peppers, fresh lemons, or other vegetables.  Present it with white rice, a dab of softened butter, and a sprinkling of sumac.
